listData.name: Advantage Plus Account
listData.description: Our Advantage Plus Account is a straightforward 'at call' transaction account available exclusively to members aged 55 years and over. This account enables you to manage your everyday banking while earning a competitive rate of interest.

features.additionalValue: RACQ Bank has removed fees for most everyday transactions, such as eftpos transactions, internet transfers and direct debits.

fees.name: Audit Certificate
fees.additionalInfo: A certificate for Audit purposes.

fees.name: Card / PIN Postage (International)
fees.additionalInfo: Charged when your mailing address is outside of Australia and a card or PIN is mailed.

fees.name: Dishonour
fees.additionalInfo: Where a Cheque or Direct Debit is not honoured. For example, a payment would be dishonoured if you do not have sufficient available funds in your account.

fees.name: Cash Request
fees.additionalInfo: Cash withdrawals of more than $5,000 require 24 hours' notice. Cash delivery charges, levied by the cash provider to RACQ Bank, are passed on at cost for large withdrawals. The charge is determined at the time of the request and may vary according to location.

fees.name: Foreign currency conversion fee
fees.additionalInfo: For any transaction made overseas or in a foreign currency, a fee of 2.75% of the total transaction value (in Australian Dollars) will be charged. The fee applies to: • Transactions made physically overseas. • Transactions made in a foreign currency, regardless of whether you’re in Australia or  another country. • Transactions processed by overseas merchants, even if the purchase or action takes  place within Australia or in Australian Dollars

fees.name: Bank Recall
fees.additionalInfo: A request to attempt to recall funds transferred to another account.

fees.name: Default Administration
fees.additionalInfo: May apply if an event of default occurs.

fees.name: Card / PIN via Courier (within Australia)
fees.additionalInfo: Charged when a card and/or PIN has been requested to be sent via courier to an address within Australia.

fees.name: Bank Trace
fees.additionalInfo: A request to trace the origin or final destination of funds either sent to or from your account.

fees.name: Emergency Replacement Card through Visa (International)
fees.additionalInfo: Charged when an emergency replacement card has been requested through VISA outside of Australia.

fees.name: Visa Chargeback
fees.additionalInfo: Charged when a Visa Debit transaction is disputed. Refunded if transaction deemed fraudulent.

fees.name: Card / PIN via Courier (International)
fees.additionalInfo: Charged when a card and/or PIN has been requested to be sent via courier to an address outside of Australia. Charged at cost in line with the international courier's charge.

fees.additionalInfo: Dishonour at member's request.

fees.additionalInfo: Transfer of funds to an overseas bank in the currency used locally. Overseas banks, including the agent bank, may charge a handling fee. Check supplied details.

fees.name: Bank@Post Cheque Dishonour
fees.additionalInfo: If you deposit a cheque via Bank@Post and it is dishonoured, a fee will be directed to your account. This fee is then refunded by RACQ Bank.

features.additionalValue: RACQ Bank has removed fees for most everyday transactions, such as eftpos transactions, internet transfers and direct debits.

fees.name: Card / PIN Postage (International)
fees.additionalInfo: Charged when your mailing address is outside of Australia and a card or PIN is mailed.

fees.name: Bank@Post Cheque Dishonour
fees.additionalInfo: If you deposit a cheque via Bank@Post and it is dishonoured, a fee will be directed to your account. This fee is then refunded by RACQ Bank.

fees.name: Default Administration
fees.additionalInfo: May apply if an event of default occurs.

fees.name: Foreign currency conversion fee
fees.additionalInfo: For any transaction made overseas or in a foreign currency, a fee of 2.75% of the total transaction value (in Australian Dollars) will be charged. The fee applies to: • Transactions made physically overseas. • Transactions made in a foreign currency, regardless of whether you’re in Australia or another country. • Transactions processed by overseas merchants, even if the purchase or action takes place within Australia or in Australian Dollars

fees.name: Bank Recall
fees.additionalInfo: A request to attempt to recall funds transferred to another account.

fees.name: Overseas Telegraphic Transfer in Australian Dollars
fees.additionalInfo: Transfer of funds to an overseas bank in AUD rather than local currency. Overseas banks, including the agent bank, may charge a handling fee. Check supplied details.

fees.name: Telegraphic Transfer - Outward (within Australia)
fees.additionalInfo: Funds transferred via the SWIFT network to another financial institution within Australia for same day payment (also known as a Wire or RTGS payment).

fees.name: Cash Request
fees.additionalInfo: Cash withdrawals of more than $5,000 require 24 hours' notice. Cash delivery charges, levied by the cash provider to RACQ Bank, are passed on at cost for large withdrawals. The charge is determined at the time of the request and may vary according to location.

fees.name: Card / PIN via Courier (International)
fees.additionalInfo: Charged when a card and/or PIN has been requested to be sent via courier to an address outside of Australia. Charged at cost in line with the international courier's charge.

fees.additionalInfo: A certificate for Audit purposes.

fees.name: Visa Chargeback
fees.additionalInfo: Charged when a Visa Debit transaction is disputed. Refunded if transaction deemed fraudulent.

fees.name: Card / PIN via Courier (within Australia)
fees.additionalInfo: Charged when a card and/or PIN has been requested to be sent via courier to an address within Australia.

fees.name: Overseas Telegraphic Transfer in Local Currency
fees.additionalInfo: Transfer of funds to an overseas bank in the currency used locally. Overseas banks, including the agent bank, may charge a handling fee. Check supplied details.

fees.name: Default Enforcement Expenses
fees.additionalInfo: May apply if enforcement services are required as part of default administration.

fees.name: Bank Trace
fees.additionalInfo: A request to trace the origin or final destination of funds either sent to or from your account.

fees.name: Emergency Replacement Card through Visa (International)
fees.additionalInfo: Charged when an emergency replacement card has been requested through VISA outside of Australia.

fees.name: Dishonour - Manual
fees.additionalInfo: Dishonour at member's request.

fees.name: Dishonour
fees.additionalInfo: Where a Cheque or Direct Debit is not honoured. For example, a payment would be dishonoured if you do not have sufficient available funds in your account.

depositRates.additionalInfo: Currently all credit balances receive the same rate. The interest structure of the product remains as a Per Tier (Stepped) basis, as tiering may be reapplied to this product in future.

lendingRates.additionalInfo: Minimum repayment: Unless the balance of the account outstanding at the end of a statement period is zero, your minimum monthly repayments will be equal to $20.00 or 5% of the balance of the account outstanding at the end of the statement period, whichever is the greater, plus any amount exceeding the Credit Limit (including interest, fees and charges accrued during each statement period). If the balance of the account is less than $20.00, the total balance is due.
